The shooter told police he “just wanted to get myself a name.” His death sentence was commuted to life in prison when the Supreme Court struck down the death penalty in 1972.

He left a suicide note saying he had been fighting “overwhelming violent impulses” and requested an autopsy, which revealed a small brain tumor.
